definition: ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now
a moment ago/just now/(indicating sth happening later than expected)/(preceded by a clause of condition or reason) not until/(followed by a numerical clause) only

sentences.english: The best ideas have to win, otherwise you don’t have good people who stay.
sentences.chinese: 最棒的点子总会胜出，除非你身边的都是些庸才。

sentences.english: They seemed to be a drab assortment of mediocrities.
sentences.chinese: 他们看起来像一批毫不起眼的碌碌庸才。

sentences.english: You'll wind up a rich mediocrity.
sentences.chinese: 你最后会成为富有的庸才。

sentences.english: In football, as elsewhere, protectionism merely coddles the mediocre.
sentences.chinese: 不论在足球，还是其他方面，保护主义只能培养庸才。

sentences.english: The third option is to muddle through, shedding a few duds and tolerating the rest.
sentences.chinese: 第三种选择是得过且过，裁掉几个庸才，容忍其他的。

sentences.english: Only lazybones and mediocre persons could hanker after the days of messing together.
sentences.chinese: 只有懒汉庸才才会留恋那大锅饭的年代。

definition: wine sack, food bag (idiom); useless person, only fit for guzzling and boozing
expert at appointing people according to their abilities (idiom)/to put the right people in the right places
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
outstanding talent/wise and able person/illustrious individual
